de.propra2.ausleiherino24.web

Class ArticleController

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.propra2.ausleiherino24.web.ArticleController

  • @Controller
 @RequestMapping(value="/article")
public class ArticleController
extends java.lang.Object
    'ArticleController' manages all requests related to article creation, updates, and deactivation.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ArticleController(ArticleService articleService, UserService userService, ImageService imageService, CustomerReviewService customerReviewService, CalendarEventService calendarEventService)
      Autowired ArticleController constructor.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView createNewArticle(java.security.Principal principal)
      Creates a new Article object, feeds it to Model and lets Principal fill-in information about Principal's article, that they want to offer.
      java.lang.String deactivateArticle(java.lang.Long id)
      Deactivates a specific article, that Principal offers, and tells them, that it has been deleted.
      org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView displayArticle(java.lang.Long id, java.security.Principal principal)
      Displays all information available for requested Article object.
      org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView saveNewArticle(@Valid Article article, org.springframework.validation.BindingResult result, org.springframework.web.multipart.MultipartFile image, java.security.Principal principal)
      Saves newly created and edited Article object to database after setting non-user-adjustable attributes.

      Mapping for save a new Article which will be sold.
      java.lang.String updateArticle(Article article)
      Saves changes, authored by Principal, to already persistent Article object.

      • ArticleController

        @Autowired
public ArticleController(ArticleService articleService,
                                    UserService userService,
                                    ImageService imageService,
                                    CustomerReviewService customerReviewService,
                                    CalendarEventService calendarEventService)
        Autowired ArticleController constructor.
        Parameters:
        articleService - Abstraction of service layer, regarding Article objects.
        userService - Abstraction of service layer, regarding User objects.
        imageService - Abstraction of service layer, regarding Image objects.
        customerReviewService - Abstraction of service layer, regarding CustomerReview objects.

    • Method Detail

      • displayArticle

        @GetMapping(value="")
public org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView displayArticle(@RequestParam(value="id")
                                                                                         java.lang.Long id,
                                                                                         java.security.Principal principal)
        Displays all information available for requested Article object.
        Parameters:
        id - ID of Article object, which will be displayed.
        principal - Current user.
        Returns:
        Specific article view.

      • createNewArticle

        @GetMapping(value="/create")
public org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView createNewArticle(java.security.Principal principal)
        Creates a new Article object, feeds it to Model and lets Principal fill-in information about Principal's article, that they want to offer.
        Parameters:
        principal - Current user.
        Returns:
        Article creation view.

      • saveNewArticle

        @PostMapping(value="/saveNew")
public org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView saveNewArticle(@ModelAttribute @Valid
                                                                                                  @Valid Article article,
                                                                                                  org.springframework.validation.BindingResult result,
                                                                                                  @RequestParam(value="image")
                                                                                                  org.springframework.web.multipart.MultipartFile image,
                                                                                                  java.security.Principal principal)
        Saves newly created and edited Article object to database after setting non-user-adjustable attributes.
        Parameters:
        article - Article object.
        result - must not be deleted. Necessary to create article without a picture.
        image - Image, that the user uploaded to be displayed.
        principal - Current user.
        Returns:
        Redirects the user to the main page aka index.html.

      • saveNewArticleForSale

        @PostMapping(value="/saveNewToSell")
public org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView saveNewArticleForSale(@ModelAttribute @Valid
                                                                                                               @Valid Article article,
                                                                                                               org.springframework.validation.BindingResult result,
                                                                                                               @RequestParam(value="image")
                                                                                                               org.springframework.web.multipart.MultipartFile image,
                                                                                                               java.security.Principal principal)
        Mapping for save a new Article which will be sold. If you want to you can try to make on mapping out of this and saveNewArticle

      • updateArticle

        @PutMapping(value="/saveUpdated")
public java.lang.String updateArticle(Article article)
        Saves changes, authored by Principal, to already persistent Article object.
        Parameters:
        article - Article object, that has been updated.
        Returns:
        Redirects the user to their personal article overview.

      • deactivateArticle

        @PutMapping(value="/deactivate")
public java.lang.String deactivateArticle(@RequestParam
                                                                           java.lang.Long id)
        Deactivates a specific article, that Principal offers, and tells them, that it has been deleted.
        Parameters:
        id - ID of Article object, which will be deactivated.
        Returns:
        Redirects the user to their personal article overview.
